Derek, I don't mean to imply that emotion is unrelated to cognition. =
 
I also do believe that emotion is adaptive.  So that wasn't my intent.

M=
ainly I was just saying that emotion is very complex and therefore 
will no=
t emerge from simple models (whatever they are models of).  

It is true th=
at some emotions can possibly be described by simple 
processes.  For examp=
le, being excited might just be a single hormone 
attenuating a bunch of ne=
ural receptor sites simultaneously.  
However, the emotion itself is consti=
tuted of more than just the 
hormone hitting the receptor sites; more than =
that, it includes all 
the consequent activation through the entire network=
, which is as 
complex as the brain itself.

ken
